citation.abstract: RNA-sequencing of a case of acute myeloid leukemia with the bone marrow karyotype 46,XY,t(2;14)(q22;q32)[5]/47,XY,idem,+?4,del(6)(q13q21)[cp6]/46,XY[4] showed that the t(2;14) generated a ZEB2-BCL11B chimera in which exon 2 of ZEB2 (nucleotide 595 in the sequence with accession number NM_014795.3) was fused to exon 2 of BCL11B (nucleotide 554 in the sequence with accession number NM_022898.2). RT-PCR together with Sanger sequencing verified the presence of the above-mentioned fusion transcript. All functional domains of BCL11B are retained in the chimeric protein. Abnormal expression of BCL11B coding regions subjected to control by the ZEB2 promoter seems to be the leukemogenic mechanism behind the translocation.
citation.title: Novel ZEB2-BCL11B Fusion Gene Identified by RNA-Sequencing in Acute Myeloid Leukemia with t(2;14)(q22;q32)

author.name: Fabrice Leclerc
author.description: #RNomics, #RNA biology, RNA #bioinformatics, #RNA_World & #evolution, technologies & resources, daily papers: http://bit.ly/HaycPM & http://bit.ly/18cyMMK

blogs.title: Exercise: The machine-learning approach to named entity recognition
blogs.summary:
In this practical, you will be using the well-known tool ABNER, which relies on a statistical machine-learning method called conditional random fields (CRFs) to recognize entities in text.
To install ABNER, simply download abner.jar from the website. To ru

blogs.title: Exercise: The dictionary-based approach to named entity recognition
blogs.summary:
In this practical, you will be using a newly developed tool EXTRACT, which shares many parts with the better known tool Reflect. Unlike ABNER, these tools identify named entities by matching a large dictionary against the text.
